1.question: Shop is open and ready to service patients/visitors according to operating hours.

2.question: Staff Attendance: adequate staff for peak and non-peak hours.

3.question: At least one (1) clearly assigned person in-charge on site.

4.question: Staff who are unfit for work due to illness should not report to work).

5.question: Staff who are fit for work but suffering from the lingering effects of a cough and/or cold should cover their mouths with a surgical mask.

6.question: Clean clothes/uniform or aprons are worn during food preparation and food service.

7.question: Hair is kept tidy (long hair must be tied up) and covered with clean caps or hair nets where appropriate.

8.question: Sores, wounds or cuts on hands, if any, are covered with waterproof and brightly-coloured plaster.

9.question: Hands are washed thoroughly with soap and water, frequently and at appropriate times.

10.question: Fingernails are short, clean, unpolished and without nail accessories.

11.question: No wrist watches/ rings or other hand jewellery (with exception of wedding ring) is worn by staff handling food.

12.question: Food is handled with clean utensils and gloves.

13.question: Disposable gloves are changed regularly and/ or in between tasks. Staff do not handle cash with gloved hands.

14.question: Cleaning and maintenance records for equipment, ventilation and exhaust system.

15.question: Adequate and regular pest control. Pest control record.

16.question: Goods and equipment are within shop boundary.

17.question: Store display/ Shop front is neat and tidy.

18.question: Work/ serving area is neat, clean and free of spillage.

19.question: Uncluttered circulation space free of refuse/ furniture.

20.question: Tables are cleared promptly within 10 minutes.

21.question: Fixtures and fittings including shelves, cupboards and drawers are clean and dry, free from pests, and in a good state.

22.question: Ceiling/ ceiling boards are free from stains/ dust with no gaps.

23.question: Fans and air-con units are in proper working order and clean and free from dust. Proper maintenance and routine cleaning are carried out regularly.

24.question: Equipment, exhaust hood, crockery and utensils are clean, in good condition and serviced.

25.question: Surfaces, walls and ceilings within customer areas are dry and clean.

26.question: Floor within customer areas is clean, dry and non-greasy.

27.question: Waste bins are properly lined with plastic bags and covered at all times.

28.question: Adequate number of covered waste pedal bins are available and waste is properly managed and disposed. Waste bins are not over-filled. Waste Management: Proper disposal of food stuff and waste. Waste is properly bagged before disposing it at the waste disposal area/ bin centre.

29.question: Hand washing facilities are easily accessible, in good working condition and soap is provided.

30.question: Adequate facilities for hand hygiene are available including liquid soap and disposable hand towels.

31.question: Food is stored in appropriate conditions and at an appropriate temperature.

32.question: Food and non-food are clearly segregated. Non-food items (e.g. insecticides, detergents and other chemicals) are not stored together with the food items.

33.question: Food is not placed near sources of contamination.

34.question: Storage of food does not invite pest infestation.

35.question: Dry goods (e.g. canned food and drinks) and other food items are stored neatly on shelves, off the floor and away from walls.

36.question: Proper stock rotation system such as the First-Expired-First-Out (FEFO) system is used for inventory management.

37.question: Food is protected from contamination; packaging is intact and no products are found with signs of spoilage.

38.question: Ice machine is clean and well maintained. Only ice is stored in the ice machine to prevent contamination of the ice.

39.question: Scoop for ice is stored outside the ice machine in a dedicated container.

40.question: Food supplied is clean and not expired.

41.question: Clear labelling of date of date of preparation/ manufacture/ expiry on all food containers/packaging.

42.question: Cooked food is properly covered to prevent cross-contamination.

43.question: Proper work flow and segregation of areas to prevent cross-contamination between raw and cooked/ ready-to-eat food areas.

44.question: Proper separation of cooked food/ ready-to-eat food, raw meat, seafood and vegetable to prevent cross-contamination. E.g. Different chopping boards, knives and other utensils are used for cooked/ ready-to-eat and raw food.

45.question: Frozen food is thawed in chiller, microwave or under running water.

46.question: Ingredients used are clean and washed thoroughly before cooking.

47.question: All cooking ingredient (e.g. cooking oil, sauces) are properly covered in proper containers and properly labelled, indicating the content and date of expiry.

48.question: All sauces are stored at appropriate condition & temperature.

49.question: Cooking oil is not used for more than 1 day.

50.question: Cooking oil is properly stored with a cover.

51.question: Perishable food is stored in the fridge.

52.question: Raw food and cooked food/ ready to serve food are clearly segregated. Cold and/ or hot holding units are clean and well maintained.

53.question: Food preparation area is free of bird and animal (e.g. dog or cat).

54.question: Food preparation area is clean, free of pests and in good state of repair.

55.question: Food is not prepared on the floor, near drain or near/ in toilet.

56.question: Personal belongings are kept separately in the staff locker area or cabinet, away from the food storage and preparation area.

57.question: Daily Temperature Log for food storage units (freezers, chillers, warmers, steamers, ovens) using independent thermometer, etc. is maintained for inspection from time to time.

58.question: Food storage units (freezers, chillers, warmers, steamers, ovens) are kept clean and well maintained. All rubber gaskets of refrigerators / warmers are free from defect, dirt and mould.

59.question: Food storage units are not overstocked to allow good air circulation.

60.question: For walk-in freezers and chillers, food items are stored neatly on shelves and off the floor.

61.question: Frozen food is stored at a temperature of not more than -12Â°C. Freezerâ€™s temperature: < -12Â°C

62.question: Chilled food is stored at a temperature of not more than 4Â°C. Chillerâ€™s temperature: 0Â°C ~ 4Â°C

63.question: Hot food are held above 60Â°C. Food warmerâ€™s temperature: > 60Â°C

64.question: Perishable food is stored at a temperature of not more than 4Â°C.

65.question: Dairy products are stored at a temperature of not more than 7Â°C.

66.question: Cooked/ ready-to-eat food are stored above raw food.

67.question: Food items are properly wrapped/covered in proper containers and protected from contamination.

68.question: Min. no. of healthier variety of food items per stall. Lease Term: 50% of food items.

69.question: Label caloric count of healthier options.

70.question: Include HPBâ€™s Identifiers beside healthier options.

73.question: Healthier option food sold at lower price than regular items.

74.question: Limit deep-fried and pre-deep fried food items sold (â‰¤ 20% deep-fried items).

75.question: No sugar / Lower-sugar brewed beverage offerings according to guidelines.

76.question: Healthier option beverages sold at lower price than regular items.

77.question: Label caloric count of healthier options.

78.question: Limit sugar content on commercially-prepared sweetened beverages. (â‰¥ 70% commercially-prepared sweetened beverages sold to have HCS)

79.question: All food handlers have Basic Food Hygiene certificate and a valid Refresher Food Hygiene certificate (if applicable).

80.question: MSDS for all industrial chemicals are available and up to date.

82.question: All detergent and bottles containing liquids are labelled appropriately.

83.question: All personnel to wear safety shoes and safety attire where necessary.

84.question: Knives and sharp objects are kept at a safe place.

85.question: Area under the sink should not be cluttered with items other than washing agents.

86.question: Delivery personnel do not stack goods above the shoulder level.

87.question: Stacking of goods does not exceed 600mm from the ceiling and heavy items at the bottom, light items on top.

88.question: Proper signage/ label (fire, hazards, warnings, food stuff) and Exit signs in working order.

89.question: Equipment, crockery and utensils are not chipped, broken or cracked.

90.question: Fire extinguishers access is unobstructed; Fire extinguishers are not expired and employees know how to use them.

91.question: Escape route and exits are unobstructed.

92.question: First aid box is available and well-equipped.

93.question: Electrical sockets are not overloaded â€“ one plug to one socket.

94.question: Plugs and cords are intact and free from exposure/ tension with PSB safety mark.

95.question: Power points that are in close proximity to flammable and/or water sources are installed with a plastic cover.

1.question: SafeEntry has been implemented for dine-in customers.

2.question: Temperature screening is conducted for customers of outlets that are located outside of institutionâ€™s temperature screening zone.

3.question: Table and seating arrangement adheres to the one-metre spacing between tables or groups. Where tables/seats are fixed, tables/seats should be marked out, ensuring at least one-metre spacing.

4.question: Queue is demarcated to ensure at least one-metre spacing between customers such as entrances and cashier counters (e.g. through floor markers).

5.question: Staff to ensure customers maintain safe distance of one-metre when queuing and seated.

6.question: Staff to ensure customers wear a mask at all times, unless eating or drinking.

7.question: Hand sanitizers are placed at high touch areas (i.e. tray return, collection point, outlet entrance/exit).

8.question: Outlet promotes use of cashless payment modes.

9.question: All staff to wear a mask at all times, unless eating or drinking.

10.question: Mask worn by staff is in the correct manner (i.e. cover nose and mouth, no hanging of mask under the chin/neck).

11.question: All staff to record their temperature daily.

12.question: Staff to maintain safe distance of one-metre (where possible) and not congregate, including at common areas, and during break/meal times.

13.question: Check with supervisor that all staff record SafeEntry check-in and check-out (Note: Supervisor is accountable for adherence)
